PAD_WaveSpawned2.synopsis: Player reacts to the third wave of attackers as they await Halsin's return from a portal they are protecting.

AD_BedTalk.synopsis: Halsin talks to J'ehlar about Art's condition. Art is a flaming fist who was caught in the curse and has been rendered largely catatonic. He has important info about thaniel, the spirit of the land.

Spirit.synopsis: The player tries to interact with Thaniel, the spirit of the land, after Halsin rescues him from the Shadowfell. Thaniel is unconscious/unresponsive however.Later - Thaniel is recovering and able to talk. A somewhat otherworldly, wise far beyond his years 'child'. He instructs you on what comes next/offers his thanks once you have succeeded.
Spirit.how_to_trigger: 1. Go to debug book2. Set quest flags and optiond -> act 2 -> GLO - Lifting the Curse -> Quest States -> Halsin at camp with spirit3. Go to camp4. Talk to Thaniel

PAD_WaveSpawned3.synopsis: Commenting on a wave of enemies unleashed against them by the shadow curse (gith warriors this time) as they await Halsin's return from a portal they are protecting.

PAD_WaveSpawned4.synopsis: Player reacts to the final wave of attackers as they await Halsin's return from a portal they are protecting.

PortalEntry.synopsis: Halsin has been conducting a ritual to open a portal to the Shadowfell while the player defends him from attacking shadows. In this case, the player interfered with the portal (trying to enter it themselves) causing it to collapse. Halsin reacts, aghast. His one chance to infiltrate the Shadowfell and lift the shadow curse has been lost. He expresses his anger to the player and walks off. Ultimately he will part ways from us for good sometime soon after.
PortalEntry.how_to_trigger: Attempt to enter Halsin's portal before he uses it himself.

PAD_HalsinDeath.synopsis: Player reacts to Halsin being killed by shadows while he'd been trying to open a portal to the Shadowfell.
PAD_HalsinDeath.how_to_trigger: Allow Halsin to die in the combat at the lakeshore.

AD_HalsinCombat.synopsis: ADs from Halsin while he's conducting the ritual to open a portal to the Shadowfell while the player fights off shadows. Once he's ready, he departs via the portal.
AD_HalsinCombat.how_to_trigger: Speak to Halsin at the lake shore after he's gotten the info he needs from Art, the cursed fist, then start the portal ritual.

Halsin.synopsis: A fallback scene where Halsin has visited Art, the cursed flaming fist in the Last Light Inn, but the player has not yet fulfilled the requirements for the story to progress (waking Art by retrieving his guitar). Halsin needs to speak to Art, and supposes that there must be a way to stir him.
Halsin.how_to_trigger: Speak to Halsin in HAV_CursedFist, but do not revive Art the Cursed Fist. Then speak to Halsin again.

PortalEmerge.synopsis: Halsin exits the portal and carries in his arms the Spirit of the Land before setting him down, while the portal to the shadowfell closes. He realises something is wrong with the boy and takes him away to the campsite for examination
PortalEmerge.how_to_trigger: 1. Start the lakeside fight in Lifting the Curse. 2. Wait for Halsin to emerge after a certain amount of turns.3. Or kill all enemies (killcombat breaks the situation)4. Dialog should start

PAD_WaveSpawned0.synopsis: Player reacts to the first wave of attackers as they await Halsin's return from a portal they are protecting.

Portal.synopsis: After the player acquires Art's instrument from the Surgeon, and speaks to Art, Halsin is able to use information given by Art to navigate through the Shadowfell, with the intention of recuing Thaniel, the spirit of the land, and ultimately lifting the shadow curse. He asks the player to help him by protecting a portal to the Shadowfell until he can return with Thaniel. He waits by the shore a short distance from Last Light. Once Halsin enters the portal and the dialogue ends, shadow creatures attack. The player must fight off the creatures until Halsin returns. However, if the player attempts to go through the portal themselves, the ritual will fail.
Portal.how_to_trigger: Speak to Halsin at the lakeshore near Last Light after he moves there after the Cursed Fist has been revived, and directed him.

PAD_HalsinReachedPortal.synopsis: The player comments after Halsin successfully enters his portal to travel to the Shadowfell
PAD_HalsinReachedPortal.how_to_trigger: Protect Halsin until the portal ritual is complete.

PAD_WaveSpawned1.synopsis: Player reacts to the second wave of attackers (former absolute cultists) as they await Halsin's return from a portal they are protecting.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After analyzing the session data, several logical ordering and branching constraints emerge. First, there is a branch that follows the intended portal defense and narrative progression. In this branch the player talks with Halsin about Art’s condition (AD_BedTalk) which then leads to the combat/ritual sequence (AD_HalsinCombat) and the portal sequence (Portal). Once the portal is activated, a series of wave reaction dialogues occur in numerical sequence: PAD_WaveSpawned0, then PAD_WaveSpawned1, PAD_WaveSpawned2, PAD_WaveSpawned3, and finally PAD_WaveSpawned4. In addition, after the portal sequence, there is a scene capturing the completion of the ritual, PAD_HalsinReachedPortal, and a scene where Halsin emerges from the portal carrying the Spirit (PortalEmerge) which subsequently leads to the session (Spirit) when the player interacts with Thaniel. A second branch appears when the player interferes by trying to enter the portal too early (PortalEntry) – this branch represents an alternate failure path that denounces the regular portal progression. Likewise, there is an alternate branch where Halsin dies in combat (PAD_HalsinDeath) instead of successfully entering the portal. Finally, there is a fallback scene (Halsin) that is used when the player has not met the requirements for progression (i.e. reviving Art) and is therefore mutually exclusive with the progression branch that begins with AD_BedTalk. Based on these observations, ordering constraints can be described for the main branch and exclusiveness rules can be specified for the alternate branches because the occurrence of one branch excludes the others.

PAD_WaveSpawned2_0.speaker: Player
PAD_WaveSpawned2_0.text: More foes - Halsin better get back soon.

AD_BedTalk_1.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_1.text: Is it working? I thought he would be awake.
AD_BedTalk_1.context: NodeContext: Intent. Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_6.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_6.text: Something's improved, but his wits may take time.
AD_BedTalk_6.context: NodeContext:  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_7.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_7.text: Time is not something we have in abundance. Lives are at stake.
AD_BedTalk_7.context: NodeContext: some urgency.  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_3.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_3.text: He's looking at me, I'm sure of it.
AD_BedTalk_3.context: NodeContext: Intent, hope rising.  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_16.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_16.text: Yes... I think so. Art? Can you hear us?
AD_BedTalk_16.context: NodeContext: growing hope.  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_8.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_8.text: Art? Hail, Art - can you hear me?
AD_BedTalk_8.context: NodeContext: Calling gently, as if to a sleeping patient. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_0.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_0.context: NodeContext: A little despair. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_9.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_9.text: Has he shown any sign of coming to his senses?
AD_BedTalk_9.context: NodeContext: Concerned. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_19.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_19.text: None. His wits have departed him, I fear.
AD_BedTalk_19.context: NodeContext: Concerned. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_5.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_5.text: Do not give up hope just yet.
AD_BedTalk_5.context: NodeContext: resolve. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_10.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_10.text: He is lucky to have you watching over him, thank you.
AD_BedTalk_10.context: NodeContext: Grateful. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_2.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_2.text: Of course. We look after our own.
AD_BedTalk_2.context: NodeContext: Proud. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_14.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_14.context: NodeContext: hopeful.  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_4.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_4.context: NodeContext: 'not so fast'.  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_15.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_15.text: I wonder if he can hear us.
AD_BedTalk_15.context: NodeContext: Wondering. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_13.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_13.text: Hard to tell. Sometimes he stirs and moans as if in a nightmare.

AD_BedTalk_11.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_11.text: One from which he will awaken soon.
AD_BedTalk_11.context: NodeContext: resolve. Art Cullagh still catatonic.

AD_BedTalk_17.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_17.text: His pallor is improving, at least.
AD_BedTalk_17.context: NodeContext:  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_12.speaker: Fist J'ehlar
AD_BedTalk_12.text: Indeed - some more life is flowing into him.
AD_BedTalk_12.context: NodeContext:  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

AD_BedTalk_18.speaker: Halsin
AD_BedTalk_18.text: Now if only words would flow out of him.
AD_BedTalk_18.context: NodeContext:  Art Cullagh still recuperating but Halsin hasn't spoken to him yet.

Spirit_4.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_4.text: Your path leads away from me, I sense. Be safe. Perhaps one day you will see the fruits that your victory has sown here.

Spirit_6.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_6.text: You did it. Ketheric Thorm is no more - the shadows' grip is broken. Soon the land shall heal.

Spirit_1.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_1.text: Not as glad as I am.

Spirit_10.speaker: Player
Spirit_10.text: Seems like the sort of feat that might deserve a reward...

Spirit_2.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_2.text: I would agree. But patience is needed.

Spirit_9.speaker: Player
Spirit_9.text: My work here is done, I think.

Spirit_0.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_0.text: It is. But mine is just beginning again. Soon this will be a place of sunlight and greenery again, with birdsong honouring your triumph.

Spirit_11.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_11.text: Nature moves at its own pace, and bestows its bounty when it sees fit. Give it time - a reward shall come to you, when you need it most.

Spirit_8.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_8.text: Ketheric's soul still nourishes the shadows. Destroy him, so the land may heal. So that I may heal.
Spirit_8.context: NodeContext: emphasis on the final 'I'. he himself is the spirit of the land so he's making the connection to the previous phrase explicitly

Spirit_13.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_13.text: The druid Halsin spoke to me while I was sleeping. He spoke of you - said that you fought shadow and spite to restore me.

Spirit_12.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_12.text: A hundred years of sickness, almost ended. I feel every root that riddles the earth beginning to unfold.

Spirit_7.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_7.text: But there is one anchor still holding the shadows in place. The soul that brought it into being.

Spirit_5.speaker: Thaniel
Spirit_5.text: For the land to heal, Ketheric Thorm must die.

Spirit_14.speaker: Narrator
Spirit_14.text: *Thaniel is unresponsive. He hardly looks alive.*
Spirit_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Thaniel is lying on the ground, unconscious.

PAD_WaveSpawned3_0.speaker: Player
PAD_WaveSpawned3_0.text: Gith warriors? Some must have fallen to the curse.

PAD_WaveSpawned4_0.speaker: Player
PAD_WaveSpawned4_0.text: I can sense Halsin - we just have to buy him a little more time!

PortalEntry_9.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player tries to enter the portal, the portal rejects the player before closing.NodeContext: Sudden alarm

PortalEntry_15.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_15.text: It's gone... that was our one chance. You've doomed this place to darkness!
PortalEntry_15.context: NodeContext: Shock gives way to a furious outburst.

PortalEntry_0.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_0.text: I warned you - told you this was my burden to carry. Why didn't you listen?
PortalEntry_0.context: NodeContext: Anger cools back down to sorrow and disappointment.

PortalEntry_11.speaker: Player
PortalEntry_11.text: I'm sorry - I acted on instinct.

PortalEntry_8.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_8.text: Words won't repair what's been done to this land. Nothing will... I need to be alone.
PortalEntry_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: walks away after delivering the line, dejectedNodeContext: dejected

PortalEntry_2.speaker: Player
PortalEntry_2.text: I did all the work here - I couldn't just let you take the glory.

PortalEntry_1.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_1.text: Glory?! There's no glory here. Now there's nothing here - only shadows and the total absence of hope.

PortalEntry_13.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_13.text: There is nothing more to be said... I need to be alone.
PortalEntry_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: walks away after delivering the line, dejectedNodeContext: Dejected

PortalEntry_14.speaker: Player
PortalEntry_14.text: I saved your grove - I figured it'd be best if I handled this as well.

PortalEntry_5.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_5.text: We were this close to healing these lands. Now your arrogance has torn open the wounds once more.

PortalEntry_4.speaker: Player
PortalEntry_4.text: I thought my powers were equal to yours.

PortalEntry_3.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_3.text: It wasn't just power this needed - it was wisdom, understanding. I suffered along with this place for years trying to understand the curse... and it seems I will continue to do so.
PortalEntry_3.context: NodeContext: Angry for the first sentence, then cooling to dejection for the second.

PortalEntry_6.speaker: Player
PortalEntry_6.text: I trusted in Selûne to guide me through the shadows.

PortalEntry_12.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_12.text: My friend - I wish you had trusted in me.
PortalEntry_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: walks away after delivering the line, dejectedNodeContext: dejected

PortalEntry_10.speaker: Player
PortalEntry_10.text: The Shadowfell is no place for non-believers - I couldn't allow you to soil it.

PortalEntry_7.speaker: Halsin
PortalEntry_7.text: I should never have trusted an ally of the Dark Lady.
PortalEntry_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: walks away after delivering the line, dejectedNodeContext: Dejected

PAD_HalsinDeath_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HalsinDeath_0.text: Halsin... he's dead. No chance of lifting the curse now.

AD_HalsinCombat_0.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_0.text: It's ready - I'm going through. May the Oak Father guide me back to you.
AD_HalsinCombat_0.context: NodeContext: Urgent shout to the player. He's ready to enter the portal he's opened.

AD_HalsinCombat_1.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_1.text: Open - let me pass. I beseech. I beg. I DEMAND!
AD_HalsinCombat_1.context: NodeContext: Reciting ritual language to open a portal to another world. Urgent concentration (there are attacking creatures being held at bay by the player while he is conducting the ritual)

AD_HalsinCombat_2.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_2.text: Carve a way through the shadows. Cast light on what is sought.
AD_HalsinCombat_2.context: NodeContext: Reciting ritual language to open a portal to another world. Urgent concentration (there are attacking creatures being held at bay by the player while he is conducting the ritual)

AD_HalsinCombat_3.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_3.text: Yield to this pilgrim. Do not hamper his path.
AD_HalsinCombat_3.context: NodeContext: Reciting ritual language to open a portal to another world. Urgent concentration (there are attacking creatures being held at bay by the player while he is conducting the ritual)

AD_HalsinCombat_4.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_4.text: Make a doorway from nothingness. Grant me passage.
AD_HalsinCombat_4.context: NodeContext: Reciting ritual language to open a portal to another world. Urgent concentration (there are attacking creatures being held at bay by the player while he is conducting the ritual)

AD_HalsinCombat_5.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_5.text: It's working - just give me some more time!
AD_HalsinCombat_5.context: NodeContext: Urgent shout of encouragement (player holding monsters at bay while Halsin works)

AD_HalsinCombat_6.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_6.text: Map the impossible. Light the way, well and true.
AD_HalsinCombat_6.context: NodeContext: Reciting ritual language to open a portal to another world. Urgent concentration (there are attacking creatures being held at bay by the player while he is conducting the ritual)

AD_HalsinCombat_7.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_7.context: NodeContext: Urgent shout of encouragement (player holding monsters at bay while Halsin works)

AD_HalsinCombat_8.speaker: Halsin
AD_HalsinCombat_8.text: Part the veil separating darkness from light.
AD_HalsinCombat_8.context: NodeContext: Reciting ritual language to open a portal to another world. Urgent concentration (there are attacking creatures being held at bay by the player while he is conducting the ritual)

Halsin_0.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_0.text: Any word? I can't help but fear the chance to save Thaniel is slipping away from us...

Halsin_18.speaker: Player
Halsin_18.text: I found a writ on the Flaming Fist.

Halsin_23.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_23.text: See what you can learn from it. It might reveal something about his actions before the curse - then we may find means to wake him.

Halsin_4.speaker: Player
Halsin_4.text: I found a lute. It seems to have belonged to the Flaming Fist.

Halsin_9.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_9.text: Good - its music might help restore him. Bring it to him.

Halsin_20.speaker: Player
Halsin_20.text: Tell Halsin what you learned from speaking to the corpse of the Flaming Fist.

Halsin_3.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_3.text: That is what I needed to know. It should be cause for joy, but... that poor man didn't have to die.

Halsin_25.speaker: Player
Halsin_25.text: His existence was worse than death. Now he's at peace, and we have what we need.

Halsin_31.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_31.text: True. But are we still deserving? Only time and nature can tell.

Halsin_16.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_16.text: You can claim it so... but I don't think it will ever be true.

Halsin_26.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_26.text: Oak Father willing, we will soon lift the curse from this place. But I suspect a shadow will linger here, because of what was done to that man.

Halsin_7.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_7.text: Meet me at the lakeshore, and be prepared. What comes next will be perilous.

Halsin_10.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_10.text: That Flaming Fist sleeps deeply - even when that winged aasimar tore through the skies overhead, he did not stir.
Halsin_10.context: NodeContext: Ah-see-mar. Referring to a story event that he witnessed offscreen.

Halsin_11.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_11.text: Now an assault is brewing against Moonrise - our time may be running short. We need to awaken the fist before it's too late.

Halsin_12.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_12.text: That fist could sleep through the end of the world - and he may do so yet, unless we can rouse him.

Halsin_17.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_17.text: That Flaming Fist survived the Shadowfell - I need to talk to him. There must be a way to rouse him from his stupor.

Halsin_33.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_33.text: If he was able to escape the Shadowfell, then it mustn't have managed to consume his spirit - not all of it, anyway.

Halsin_29.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_29.text: We need to unlock whatever's left of him, inside his head. There must be something to trigger him - a word, a memory, an item. We just need to find it.

Halsin_8.speaker: Player
Halsin_8.text: Sounds like we could be looking for almost anything to wake him.

Halsin_24.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_24.text: I'm afraid so, yes. Check his person - there might be something on him to help get us started.

Halsin_27.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_27.text: A winged aasimar tore through the skies like a bolt of lightning, crying for vengeance.
Halsin_27.context: NodeContext: Ah-see-mar. Referring to a story event that he witnessed offscreen.

Halsin_21.speaker: Halsin
Halsin_21.text: An omen of change if I ever saw one - we should double our efforts to save Thaniel, before fate wrests the chance from us. What news?

PortalEmerge_8.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin steps through the portal with an unconscious fey boy, Thaniel, in his arms (front carry). He lays him down on the ground.NodeContext: Relieved, weary from exertion

PortalEmerge_4.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The portal closes behind Halsin while he is focused on Thaniel. NodeContext: Suddenly concerned

PortalEmerge_7.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin looks up from Thaniel, troubledNodeContext: Hushed alarm.

PortalEmerge_9.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_9.text: No - but some part of him is missing. He is... hollow.
PortalEmerge_9.context: NodeContext: Something on the tip of his tongue.

PortalEmerge_0.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_0.text: I need to examine him back at the camp.

PortalEmerge_10.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_10.text: Come see us when you can. And be careful out there - forces may be rallying against Moonrise, but Ketheric Thorm is most dangerous when cornered. I know from experience.
PortalEmerge_10.context: NodeContext: Grave, with an extra word of warning referring the world events happening concurrently.

PortalEmerge_11.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_11.text: Come see us, when you can.

PortalEmerge_12.speaker: Player
PortalEmerge_12.text: We need to get Thaniel someplace safe.

PortalEmerge_5.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_5.text: Yes. I'll bring him back to camp. He'll be safest with us.

PortalEmerge_6.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_6.text: I need to examine him. I need to understand what's wrong. It's almost like something's missing from him.
PortalEmerge_6.context: NodeContext: Something on the tip of his tongue.

PortalEmerge_1.speaker: Player
PortalEmerge_1.text: The shadow curse is as strong as ever. Your plan has failed.

PortalEmerge_3.speaker: Halsin
PortalEmerge_3.text: No. Everything went exactly as it was supposed to. But there's something else - something missing from Thaniel.

PAD_WaveSpawned0_0.speaker: Player
PAD_WaveSpawned0_0.text: We need to protect the portal!

Portal_22.speaker: Halsin
Portal_22.text: You're here, good. And not a moment too soon - a winged aasimar was seen in the skies overhead, and now an assault on Moonrise is brewing.

Portal_16.speaker: Halsin
Portal_16.text: We should begin at once, before we lose the opportunity.

Portal_33.speaker: Halsin
Portal_33.text: You're here, good. Now we can begin.

Portal_18.speaker: Player
Portal_18.text: First, I want to know what to expect.

Portal_31.speaker: Halsin
Portal_31.text: Thaniel is trapped in the Shadowfell, but thanks to your efforts, I know where to look. Now I must go there - alone.

Portal_4.speaker: Player
Portal_4.text: Hold on - shouldn't I come with you?

Portal_5.speaker: Halsin
Portal_5.text: No. This opportunity has been a hundred years in the making. It has to be me, and only me.
Portal_5.context: NodeContext: Grave. 'gotta do what I gotta do'

Portal_27.speaker: Halsin
Portal_27.text: But I didn't bring you here to witness an old druid's grandstanding. You have a part to play in this - and I trust you will play it well.

Portal_32.speaker: Player
Portal_32.text: Sounds like you don't need my help anymore.

Portal_26.speaker: Halsin
Portal_26.text: Wrong. You are the beacon that will guide me home.

Portal_2.speaker: Halsin
Portal_2.text: With the Oak Father's blessing, I can infiltrate the Shadowfell, but doing so will sap my strength. I'll need your help if I'm to return.

Portal_25.speaker: Halsin
Portal_25.text: I need you to stay here. Keep the portal open until I return - and defend it at all costs.

Portal_28.speaker: Halsin
Portal_28.text: Good. Now it's important that only I pass through the portal once it opens. The magic is fragile - any mistake, and our one chance will be lost forever.

Portal_29.speaker: Player
Portal_29.text: Going in alone is suicide. I'll come with you.

Portal_0.speaker: Halsin
Portal_0.text: No. If there's any interference with the portal, then our one chance is lost forever. And so am I.

Portal_14.speaker: Halsin
Portal_14.text: I'd rather have you by my side, but this is the only way.

Portal_17.speaker: Player
Portal_17.text: Defend it? What do you mean?

Portal_21.speaker: Halsin
Portal_21.text: The shadows won't be banished without a fight. Once I open the portal, they'll swarm like carrion birds and try to destroy it. You must not let that happen.

Portal_10.speaker: Halsin
Portal_10.text: Let's begin. Remember what I told you - we won't have a second chance here.

Portal_8.speaker: Halsin
Portal_8.text: Let's begin. Whatever happens, do not attempt enter the portal, and do not let anything interfere with it.

Portal_20.speaker: Halsin
Portal_20.text: It took me years of study, of seeking the Oak Father's favour, to find a way to part the veil. Pray that this works.

Portal_6.speaker: Halsin
Portal_6.text: Oak Father, hear me, aid me. Force open the jaws of Darkness. Make passage for your vessel of Light.
Portal_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin bows his head in concentration/prayer. As he speaks, a portal opens in thin air before him.NodeContext: Concentrating. Spoken as a prayer/incantation.

Portal_24.speaker: Halsin
Portal_24.text: It's ready. I'll return with Thaniel as soon as possible. Stay close to the portal - buy me what time you can.
Portal_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin looks up at the portal he's conjured, before speaking to the player. He then steps through the portal.NodeContext: Thaniel rhymes with Daniel. Urgent, addressed to the player.

Portal_11.speaker: Player
Portal_11.text: Upon my oath, druid - I swear you shall be safe.

Portal_19.speaker: Halsin
Portal_19.text: Very well. Once I begin the ritual, a portal to the Shadowfell will open - one that will help me save Thaniel. Whatever happens - I must go alone.

Portal_23.speaker: Player
Portal_23.text: You can begin. I already did my part.

Portal_15.speaker: Halsin
Portal_15.text: You did - and most splendidly. But if we are to restore the land, there is more to be done.

PAD_HalsinReachedPortal_0.speaker: Player
PAD_HalsinReachedPortal_0.text: He made it. Now let's just hope he survives what's on the other side.

PAD_WaveSpawned1_0.speaker: Player
PAD_WaveSpawned1_0.text: Looks like the curse claimed some of the Absolute's followers as its own.
